N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 139.0 - Statement of policy

State Regulations

Subdivision 1-a of section
131
of the

Civil Service Law permits the Director of the Budget to promulgate regulations
authorizing the appointment of certain persons with training or experience
which substantially exceeds the minimum required for appointment at a salary
above the minimum of the grade of the title to which they are appointed. It is the policy of the State generally that appointments
should be made at the established salary grade minimums, but in order to
facilitate the recruitment of highly qualified people for State service, certain persons outside State service with outstanding training or experience
may be appointed above the established salary grade minimums. It is also the
policy of the State that appointments under this Part shall be restricted to
original permanent appointments to State service. Compensation of certain
incumbent State employees with equivalent qualifications of training or
experience shall be increased as provided under section
139.5
of this

Part. Notes
